title: The Return
description: Andy does the impossible--he makes everyone in the office miss Dwight, who is forced to take a job at Staples. Meanwhile, Oscar comes back to the office and Michael predictably throws a stereotypical Mexican party to celebrate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have left Dunder-Mifflin after many record-breaking years and am officially on the job market. And it's very exciting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: For your convenience, I've broken it down into three parts: professional resume, athletic and special skills resume, and Dwight Schrute trivia.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am ready to face any challenges that might be foolish enough to face me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How would I describe myself? Three words. Hard-working, Alpha male, Jackhammer, Merciless, Insatiable.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There is nothing on my horizon except everything. Everything is on my horizon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in Staples uniform] I got this job to make some money while I continue my employment search. And uh, it's fine for the time being. Oops. Break's over.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to Ryan] Big Turkey. [cellphone plays "Rockin' Robin"]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that you singing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All four parts. Recorded it on my computer. It took me forever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you muchly. [cellphone continues playing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You gonna answer it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I called it myself. I just thought you'd get a kick out of the new ring.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Side note. I'd just like to say I'm thrilled to be working directly beneath you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I feel I have a lot to learn from you, even though you're younger and have less experience.  So here's to the future... Andy and the Tuna. [sings] Andy and the tuna...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I miss Dwight. Congratulations, universe. You win.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Dwight Schrute has left this company. More personnel turnover.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The cost of doing business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, well. It is a big loss. Dwight was the top salesman...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Was the top salesman...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I said 'was'.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [chuckles] Addition by subtraction.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What does that even mean? That is impossible.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmmm. Yeah you're right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But, there is some good news. Oscar is back. Addition by addition. So we are going to have a big party today to welcome him back and hopefully that will lift everybody's spirits.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, everyone.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, hello, Oscar. How was your gay-cation?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, that's very funny.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah? I thought of it like, two seconds after you left.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [sits at his desk] Hi, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, what's up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Noooothin'. Ehrrrrrrrrr. Heh. Man. TGI-Wednesday. Am I right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gonna go home. Get my beer on. Get my "Lost" on. What are you doing later, wanna hang out?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know. Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I will take that as a maybe. [Michael gets up] Where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, well, I'm going to the kitchen, I'll walk with you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [lurking by the bathroom door] Yeah, things are going pretty good. Gettin' a lot of face time with the boss.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar? I have a question. Would you like to join the party planning committee?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The one of all women?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Because I'm gay?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. No. Certain events have transpired. And I've thought about certain things. And I'm sorry for the way those certain events transpired. [starts to cry] And I would just like to make some changes about certain things and certain situations.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: OK, OK, OK, all right, all right. I'll join. I'd love to. That's -- thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you. [sniffles]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Can I join too?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Never.

quotes.speaker: Staples Employee
quotes.text: You sell those two printers this morning? Nice work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] Child's play. Give me something hard to sell.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. [walks over to the plant] What is wrong with this thing? It looks terrible.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you want me to ask the cleaning crew if they stopped watering it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. And you know what? Ask them about the toys on my desk too. They always used to arrange them in a very pleasing way. It used to brighten my morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, that wasn't the night crew. That was Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? That was very nice of him. We need more attitude like that around the office.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Feel ya, dawg.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, do you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What did I say?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You said... [makes gibberish noises]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Which is like, "Right on." And Pam was like "blah blah blah" and you were like "Yeah, psht." Nailed it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Love that Andy, right? Solid fellow. Seems smart enough. Likes me a lot. A lot. Too much. Like a crazy person. A little. Not super crazy... just... there's something about him that creeps me out. I can't really explain it. He's always up in my bidness. Which is ebonics for "being in my face and annoying the bejesus out of me." I don't understand how someone could have so little self-awareness.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I really have no preference. We don't even have to have a party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, hey, hey. Don't be ridiculous. Of course we are going to have a party. A celebration of Oscar. Oscar night. And I want it to be Oscar-specific.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael --

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. I mean, not because you're gay. Your gayness does not define you. Your Mexican-ness is what defines you to me. And I think we should celebrate Oscar's Mexicanity. So Phyllis... I want you to go find firecrackers. And a Chihuahua. Pam, in the frozen food section, Swanson makes a delightful chimichanga.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why don't you have me riding in on a donkey into the office like Pepe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, a burro, of course. If Oscar wants a donkey, let's get him one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Need any help?

quotes.speaker: Lady
quotes.text: Oh, no, thank you. I'm just looking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Great. I will literally be standing right here if you need anything at all.

quotes.speaker: Lady
quotes.text: Okay. [moves away]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think I could go for some tuna fish right about now. Oh, oh, got my rod here. [fake casts off] Whizzzzz. [catches Jim] Click, click, click, click, click, click, click. [Jim gets up] Cli -- ah! I got one! I got one! Ahhhh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So Andy is in rare form today.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, you should not encourage him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Encourage him? I'm the victim, okay? He's fishing for me. We've got to do something.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Look, I've got like fifteen new clients I inherited from Dwight and each file is password protected with a different mythical creature. So, I'm sorry. I can't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fine. Party pooper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's that sportscaster that bit that lady? Marv something? Andy is like Marv Something. Great sportscaster. Big weirdo creep.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: 185 pounder. Check it out. Whew! ["displays" Jim who looks thoroughly annoyed]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You wanna pull a prank on Andy?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Not right now, but ask me again ten years ago.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I liked you better when you were the temp.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, me too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey guys. How's the workload on all of Dwight's old accounts? Handling it okay?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sort of. He had a lot of clients.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, he did. Have any of you talked to Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, sure, we talk all the time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't - don't do that. That's not nice. What about you, Phyllis? You and Dwight were close.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight has a big personality and I have a big personality. And a lot of times when two people like that get together it can be explosive.

quotes.speaker: Paris
quotes.text: Really comin' down out there. Commute's gonna be hell.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have snow tires and chains. Plus exceptional hand-eye coordination.

quotes.speaker: Paris
quotes.text: So um, where were you workin' before this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Paris
quotes.text: What kind of company is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] Paper company. They're only one of Staples' top competitors in the area.

quotes.speaker: Paris
quotes.text: I never heard of 'em.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa. Really? Have you heard of paper?

quotes.speaker: Paris
quotes.text: You gonna be like that, huh?

quotes.speaker: Paris
quotes.text: I don't like him, his giant head, or his beady little eyes. That's all I got to say on the matter.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] In your he-ead, in your he-eyd-ed. Zombie. Zombie. Zombie. Ey, ey, ey, ey. In your he-eyd-ed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Would you like to pull a prank on Andy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I'm kind of in the middle of -- yes please.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, good. Stay right here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [after Jim knocks over his pencils] Oh. Good move, Tuna. Nice one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [hands Pam Andy's phone] Are there any messages?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So weird.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [takes the phone] Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice to have Oscar back.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Large Tuna. Have you seen my cell phone device?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Cause someone is calling right now. There is a call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh. [hands Pam tape]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Where is my FREAKING phone?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what?  Maybe it's in the ceiling.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Maybe you're in the ceiling!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [trying to look in Phyllis's desk, she slams the drawer shut] I don't trust you, Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I wanted to let you know that Dwight was late that morning because he was driving to New York to drop off the correlated documents that I forgot to send. Though to be fair, Kevin never reminded me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why would Dwight do that for you? I think I know why. Because Dwight loves this company.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think that anyone else out there would have driven to corporate for you?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: None of them. Especially not Andy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, I have a mission to accomplish. Make sure this party gets rolling and I will be back shortly.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wait up. Where are you going? Do you want me to come with?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just listen, I forgot to tell you the plan for this Saturday. You, me, bars, beers, buzzed. Wings. Shots. Drunk. Waitresses, hot. Football - Cornell/Hofstra. Slaughter. Then a quick nap at my place and we'll hit the tiz-own.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. I don't want to do any of that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Duh. Which is why I was just joking about doing that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, just stop. Stop. Stop doing it. You're going to drive me crazy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine. I'll just sit at my desk and be quiet. Sorry I annoyed you with my friendship. [Andy's phone rings] Excuse me. And I'm also sorry that a lot of people here for some reason think it's funny to steal someone's personal property and hide it from them. Here's a little newsflash! It's not funny! In fact, it's pretty freakin' unfunny!  Oh, my GOD. [punches a hole in the wall] That... was an overreaction. Gonna hit the break room. Does anybody want anything? Pam, you good?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure? Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to customer] Well, that question is meaningless. Just go with the copy paper. It's your funeral. See how that works out for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Same old.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um. It takes a big man to admit his mistake. And I am that big man. Angela from accounting told me what you did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh my God, she told you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, she did. And Dwight, if you were willing to do something like that for some random co-worker, then clearly I have misjudged you from the beginning, and I apologize.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Accepted.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How's this place treating you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] The boss isn't funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't get to wear my ties.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. I'm sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, maybe you should come back. You should come back. Please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't want to do your laundry anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We can talk about that. [Dwight high fives Michael] All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [inspecting the hole in the wall] Oh my God, that's half-inch drywall.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think we broke his brain. [they both snicker]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [imitating Andy] "It's not freakin' funny!"

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are you enjoying your fiesta?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually, yeah. I didn't think I would, but turns out -- [Angela walks away] it's great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ladies and gentlemen! May I present... Mr. Dwight Schrute!

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: Yay. [scattered appalause]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Welcome back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Dwight, you can let go of her hand. You're gonna break it. [looks around the room] Not bad, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You did this for me? [camera pans to "Welcome Back Oscar" sign]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guilty.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh... Where did you get this stuff?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Gerty's.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Which aisle?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I don't remember.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Well, draw me a map, mama.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam. I will shake mine and then you will shake yours.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I will not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So does this remind you of your childhood right now?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It reminds me a lot of the 'Three Amigos' with Steve Martin and Chevy Chase.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Thank you. Wow, that's- thanks so much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [sighs] Do you still have feelings for her?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [long pause and then he sighs and nods] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And now, ladies and gentlemen, the big finale! Sir, would you do the honor? [hands broom to Dwight, though Oscar thinks he's handing it to him]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man. [Kevin starts to put a blindfold on] No, no, no. I don't need it. Get out! [beats up pinata]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It takes a big man to admit his mistake and that's what I did. The important thing is I learned something. I don't want somebody sucking up to me because they think I'm going to help their career. I want them sucking up to me because they genuinely love me. Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So Michael had a little chat with corporate and they decided to send me to management training. Anger management, technically, but still. Management material. [gets out of his car] This whole thing supposed to take ten weeks, but I can be done in five. How? Name repetition, personality mirroring, and positive reinforcement through nods and smiles. So, don't worry about old Andy Bernard. I'll be back. Just like Rambo, so.

quotes.speaker: Marcy
quotes.text: Oh, hi. You must be Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, hi! Yes. I am and you must be... Marcy!

quotes.speaker: Marcy
quotes.text: That's right, it's so good to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's so good to meet you!

quotes.speaker: Marcy
quotes.text: Thanks.  Well, you ready to have some fun?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.
